place.name: LLANARMON DYFFRYN CEIRIOG
place.gazetteerText: LLANARMON-DYFFRYN-CEIRIOG, a village and a parish in the district of Corwen and county of Denbigh. The village stands on the river Ceiriog, 9 miles WNW of Oswestry r. station; and has a post office, under Llangollen, and a fair on 13 Aug.—The parish contains the townships of Llowran, and Llowarch, and comprises 6,557 acres. Real property, £2,801. Pop., 315. Houses, 60. The property is not much divided. Traces exist of a double-ditched camp. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Asaph. Valne, £250.* Patron, the Bishop of Llandaff. The church was recently in disrepair. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
